page.title: 09SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: During the last ten years many retired people have moved to Witheridge , mainly to cheap bungalows.The result is a larger than usual percentage of elderly people to the rest of the population.This has made problems for the local doctor and the health service who find it difficult to cope. In Devon , Witheridge is second only to Torquay with such a high proportion of elderly people. The building of new estates has caused a severe overloading of the sewerage system.The sewers are very old and in poor condition and after heavy rainfall or a period of drought they block very easily and overflow. There have been public meetings involving planning authorities and health officials , but because of the lack of money very little has been down.
